sentences: Temasuguse mehe võtaks iga tüdruk kahel käel vastu.
Sellisele kirjale kirjutan kahe käega alla.
context: The Estonian word 'kahel' (when used in the compound form 'kahel käel') means to do something very willingly, wholeheartedly, or enthusiastically. It literally translates to 'with both hands' but idiomatically expresses complete agreement and eagerness. The phrase implies giving one's full effort and support without reservation.
